lead_paragraph: Under President Obama, the President’s Malaria Initiative has grown into a $618-million program that works in 19 African countries and in Southeast Asia. Yet the disease remains a top killer of children around the world.

byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting from New York.

headline.print_headline: Obama’s Goal to Wipe Out Malaria Comes With Serious Challenges
headline.main: Obama’s Goal to Wipe Out Malaria May Be a Dream Too Far

snippet: Under President Obama, the President’s Malaria Initiative has grown into a $618-million program that works in 19 African countries and in Southeast Asia. Yet the disease remains a top killer of children around the world.
abstract: White House Letter; Pres Obama makes ambitious pledge to rid world of malaria during final term as president; calls on Congress to increase funding for President’s Malaria Initiative, which has contributed to sharp decline in deaths from disease since 2000.
